qas.question: Heart disease and obesity are examples of what kind of disease?
In which country was a study about the presence of cancer and heart disease in different regions done?
How much of an increase in presence of "Western" diseases was there in communities that primarily had animal - based diets as opposed to vegetable diets?
Other than meat, what else is lacking from the people in China's diet compared to diets from the Western world?
What disease was said to possibly be the result of diets that are high in meat and dairy products?

context: Heart disease, cancer, obesity, and diabetes are commonly called <a0_0>"Western" diseases<a0_0/> because these maladies were once rarely seen in developing countries. An international study in <a1_0>China<a1_0/> found some regions had virtually no cancer or heart disease, while in other areas they reflected "up to a <a2_0>100-fold<a2_0/> increase" coincident with shifts from diets that were found to be entirely plant-based to heavily animal-based, respectively. In contrast, diseases of affluence like cancer and heart disease are common throughout the developed world, including the United States. Adjusted for age and exercise, large regional clusters of people in China rarely suffered from these "Western" diseases possibly because their diets are rich in vegetables, fruits, and whole grains, and have little <a3_0>dairy<a3_0/> and meat products. Some studies show these to be, in high quantities, possible causes of some <a4_0>cancers<a4_0/>. There are arguments for and against this controversial issue.
